intro: Commelina pseudomonosperma, commonly known as the false single-seeded spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and showy blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands. It produces small, three-lobed fruits that contain a single seed, which is a distinctive feature of the species. Commelina pseudomonosperma is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of humid habitats.
